required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Determination of Abnormal Fetal Growth or Amniotic Fluid With Third Trimester Ultrasounds in Uncomplicated Pregnancies: A Randomized Trial
clinical_study.official_title: Determination of Abnormal Fetal Growth or Amniotic Fluid With Third Trimester Ultrasounds in Uncomplicated Pregnancies: A Randomized Trial (UP Trial)

lead_sponsor.agency: The University of Texas Health Science Center, Houston

clinical_study.source: The University of Texas Health Science Center, Houston

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to see whether women at a gestational age of 30 weeks or more without comorbidities, does performance of serial 3rd trimester growth ultrasounds increase the frequency of identifying abnormalities in fetal growth or amniotic fluid, when compared with women who only receive indicated ultrasounds?

primary_outcome.measure: Number of participants with fetal growth restriction
Number of participants with large for gestational age fetuses
Number of participants with fetal growth restriction
Number of participants with large for gestational age fetuses
Number of participants with fetal growth restriction
Number of participants with large for gestational age fetuses

secondary_outcome.time_frame: From time of delivery to discharge (average time of discharge is 4 days after delivery)
secondary_outcome.description: Presence of morbidity is indicated by one or more of the following: 1) Apgar score < 5 at 5 min; 2) umbilical arterial pH < 7.00; 3) intraventricular hemorrhage grade III or IV; 4) periventricular leukomalacia; 5) intubation for over 24 hrs; 6) necrotizing enterocolitis grade 2 or 3; 7) stillbirth; or 8) death within 28 days of birth.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: From time of delivery to discharge (average time of discharge is 4 days after delivery)
secondary_outcome.description: The presence of morbidity is indicated by one of more of the following: 1) chorioamnionitis; 2) cesarean delivery in labor; 3) wound infection; 4) transfusion; 5) deep venous thrombus or pulmonary embolism; 6) admission to intensive care unit; or 7) death.

arm_group.description: Routine third trimester care with clinically-indicated ultrasound (control)

Ultrasound evaluation for fetal growth and amniotic fluid will be performed every 4 weeks starting at 30 weeks (intervention group). Thus, if they continue to term, there will be 3 additional ultrasounds exams (30, 34 and 38 weeks).

intervention.description: Routine third trimester care with clinically-indicated ultrasound (control)

Ultrasound evaluation for fetal growth and amniotic fluid will be performed every 4 weeks starting at 30 weeks (intervention group). Thus, if they continue to term, there will be 3 additional ultrasounds exams (30, 34 and 38 weeks).

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Maternal age of 18 at the time of consent
- Singleton gestation
Exclusion Criteria:
- First sonographic examination after 20 weeks
- Women with any of the following co-morbidities: Autoimmune disorders (antiphospholipid antibody, lupus, rheumatoid arthritis, scleroderma), Cerclage in the index pregnancy, Diabetes mellitusâ€”gestational or pre-gestational, Hematologic disorders (coagulation defects, sickle cell disease, thrombocytopenia, thrombophilia), Hypertension (chronic or pregnancy induced) before enrollment, HIV (human immunodeficiency virus), Institutionalized individuals (prisoners), Prior obstetric history of: [1) intrauterine growth restriction, 2) preterm birth before 34 weeks, 3) severe preeclampsia], eclampsia, HELLP syndrome, and 4) stillbirth after 24 weeks or neonatal death, Preterm labor or ruptured membranes before enrollment, Psychiatric disorder (bipolar, depression) on medication, Placenta previa / 3rd trimester bleeding, Renal insufficiency (serum creatinine > 1.5 mg/dL), Restrictive lung disease, Fetal red blood cell isoimmunization, Seizure disorder on medication, Thyroid disease on medication, Body Mass Index (BMI) above 40 kg/m2
- Major fetal Anomaly including: anencephaly, spina bifida, bilateral renal agenesis, cystic hygroma with hydrops, diaphragmatic hernia, or congenital heart defects
- Unable to understand consent in English or Spanish

overall_official.affiliation: The University of Texas Health Science Center, Houston

facility.name: University of Texas at Houston Health Science Center

responsible_party.investigator_affiliation: The University of Texas Health Science Center, Houston
